title: 103_hr4028
content: The Act may be cited as the "Health Care Fraud and Abuse Advisory Opinion Act of 1994". It authorizes the Secretary of Health and Human Services to issue advisory opinions under Title XI. The Health Care Fraud and Abuse Advisory Opinion Act of 1994 authorizes the Secretary of Health and Human Services to issue advisory opinions on matters such as prohibited remuneration and arrangement criteria under Title XI. The Health Care Fraud and Abuse Advisory Opinion Act of 1994 allows the Secretary of Health and Human Services to provide advisory opinions on issues related to prohibited remuneration and arrangement criteria under Title XI, excluding matters concerning fair market value for goods or services. The Health Care Fraud and Abuse Advisory Opinion Act of 1994 authorizes the Secretary of Health and Human Services to issue binding advisory opinions on prohibited remuneration and arrangement criteria, excluding fair market value considerations. The opinions are not admissible as evidence of intent to violate relevant provisions of the law. The Secretary must issue regulations within 180 days of enactment. The Health Care Fraud and Abuse Advisory Opinion Act of 1994 authorizes the Secretary of Health and Human Services to issue regulations for advisory opinions within 180 days of enactment. The regulations will outline procedures for applying, responding, and fees, as well as the interval for responses and public availability of opinions. The Secretary must respond to a party requesting an advisory opinion within 30 days. The Secretary of Health and Human Services is authorized to issue advisory opinions under Title XVIII. The Secretary of Health and Human Services is authorized to issue advisory opinions on arrangements that may result in prohibited referrals. These opinions are binding and failure to seek one cannot be used as evidence of intent to violate regulations. Regulations must be issued within 180 days of enactment. The Secretary of Health and Human Services is authorized to issue advisory opinions on arrangements that may result in prohibited referrals. Regulations must be issued within 180 days of enactment, including procedures for applying, responding, and fees for advisory opinions. The Secretary must respond within thirty days to requests for advisory opinions. SEC. 4. EFFECTIVE DATE. The Health Care Fraud and Abuse Advisory Opinion Act of 1994 will be effective upon enactment.
